topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537a5d3a6368726013e20000#post_537a5d3a6368726013e20000

Draw from reference. Alot. Start small and simple, don't be afraid to fail. Prepare for frustration as you look at the work of other artists, then look at their art and see if you can decipher anything from it to help you.


Here's a good site for people, animals, hands, and expressions.

http://artists.pixelovely.com/

"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537a5eff6368725fe93a0100#post_537a5eff6368725fe93a0100

Start anywhere really. If you wanna start with, say, mechas, start with mechas. Just do em to the best of your ability and keep trying. And remember, don't be afraid to fail doing it.

Also, if you practice for an hour a day, you'll improve somewhat quickly.

topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
Here's some advice that's helped me with drawing.

*Don't try to think of an object as one huge detailed object. Think of it as simple shapes; cube, circles, triangles. Start with the simple shapes and build up from there.*

Don't be afraid to overlap shapes and lines.

Drawing straight lines in place of rounded parts is helpful when making the initial image, curves can be added later. Though you can still use circles if you need.

Take your time, learn what you need to do. Once you know how to build it initially it becomes easier.

And don't think you have to have a perfectly clean line at first, if you need to draw a line twice to get it good, do that.

Use reference. It helps alot.


And to continue my rant, some excercises that help with drawing art.

Practice pencil handling by drawing 2 dots, then try to connect a line between the two in one stroke. Keep doing this until you get good at it, and move the dots farther apart as you improve. Eventually try to master pressure.

Draw a big circle and try to connect the start to the end in one movement. Don't expect to get this right immediately. And then draw another circle and try to have it's edge touch the previous one. Keep doing this till your page is filled with circles.

These are mostly to help build a steady hand for drawing.

And that's the end of my rant. I could keep going on about more stuff, but I'll stop there.

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537a62826368721731040200#post_537a62826368721731040200
If you are really serious about getting good you may want to look into going to art classes. No I don't mean art school like with student loans ans stuff but just a small art class in your area. You may even get private instruction and meet people who would offer to help outside of class for free.

Oregan just struck down it's gay marriage ban and is now going to the appeals court.  There is 70 court cases trying to repeal bans; many of which have already gone to the appeals court.

In other words:  There is a high probability that nearly all usa states will have legalized gay marriage by the time the next president takes office.
